text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
SOTMeaslesContactTracing 0..*BackboneElementThis is an abstract type.
Elements defined in Ancestors: @id, extension, modifierExtension
Surveillance & Outbreak Toolkit Measles- Contact Tracing
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference
caseSearchConducted 1..1codeWere active case-searches conducted?
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
noOfsuspectCases 0..1QuantityIf Yes, Number of suspect cases detected during active case-search
pregnantContact 1..1codeWas the patient in contact with any pregnant woman?
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
pregnantContactNames 0..1stringIf Yes, Name(s)
localCasesPresent 1..1codeAre there other cases present in the case’s municipality of residence?
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
travelledOutside 1..1codeDid the patient travel outside his/her province/state of residence 7-23 days before rash onset?
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
travelDetails 1..1SOTMeaslesTravelDetailsTravel History
placeOfTravel 0..1stringCities/Countries
arrivalDate 0..1dateDate of arrival
departureDate 0..1dateDate of departure
infectionSetting 1..1codeSetting where infected?
Binding: InfectionSetting (required)
specifyInfectionSetting 0..1stringSpecify

Documentation for this format

name: SOTMeaslesContactTracing
title: Surveillance & Outbreak Toolkit Measles- Contact Tracing

element.definition: Base definition for all elements that are defined inside a resource - but not those in a data type.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them
